intro: Marlierea obtusa, commonly known as the broadleaf marlierea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The plant is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories.
